properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Fairfield Spring Fest held on Harris and William Streets from 12pm to 8pm on Saturday and Sunday.

From 7pm Friday 23 September, sections of William Street, Harris Street and Downey Lane will be closed until 5am Monday 26 September. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Fairfield while the event is underway. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
FAIRFIELD

7PM FRIDAY 23 SEPTEMBER TO 5AM MONDAY 26 SEPTEMBER

  • William St between Harris St and Hamilton Rd
  • Harris St between Barbara St and Ware St
  • Southern end of Downey Lane (near Harris St)

NOTE: There will be limited access for residents, businesses and service vehicles to the abovementioned closures between 7pm Friday 23 September and midnight Saturday 24 September, and between midnight and 5am Monday 26 September.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Golden Rose Race Day - The Everest Carnival at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:40am, last race at 5:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.diversions:
Vehicles travelling from the south, west and east shall be detoured along Kookora Street, Yambil Street, and Jondaryan Avenue.

Vehicles travelling from the north shall be detoured along Wakaden Street, Kooringal Avenue, Kookora Street and Yambil Street. 

B-Doubles travelling from the south, east or west will be required to utilise Willandra Avenue, Bridge Road and the surrounding b-double network to access their destination.

The B-double route along Wyangan Avenue, Palla Street and Kookora Street will also be affected by the event.

B-double vehicles using Kooringal Avenue and Kookora Street will be held at the intersection of Kookora Street and Banna Avenue and will be marshalled through the event by an approved traffic controller where breaks in the procession are identified.

properties.otherAdvice:
Motorists should expect intermittent stops on The Esplanade to facilitate safe pedestrian movements.

Expect delays at the intersection of The Esplanade and Park Road.

Australia Cup Final: Sydney United 58 FC v Macarthur FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm and full-time around 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
Expect increased traffic and pedestrians on the New England Highway between Brook and Boyd streets.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - King of the Ranges

properties.otherAdvice: Expect increased traffic and pedestrians on the New England Highway between Brook and Boyd streets.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - King of the Ranges

properties.otherAdvice:
CAR PARKS ARE NOW FULL.

Traffic controllers are on site to direct motorists as there are currently lane closures in place.

OSOM vehicles are advised to avoid the Olympic Highway between Hume Highway and Sturt Highway during the event.


The Henty Machinery Field Days Tuesday 20 - Thursday 22 September is one of the largest exhibitions of agricultural machinery and associated products in rural Australia. The event attracts in excess of 800 exhibitors and more than 60,000 people during the three day event.

Access to the site is via a single road (Henty-Cookardinia Road).
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - Henty Machinery Field Days

webLinks.linkText: UCI Road World Championships 2022 - road closures

properties.headline: UCI Road World Championships WOLLONGONG AND SURROUNDS Princes Highway, Corrimal Street, Squires Way, Pioneer Drive
properties.publicTransport: Major bus diversions will be in effect while road closures are in place for the duration of the event. Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
The UCI Road World Championships will be hosted in Wollongong, with eight days of competitive cycle racing from 18 to 25 September and a training day on Saturday 17 September.

Major road closures and extensive special event clearways will be in effect for the duration of the event at various times.

The M1 Princes Mwy, Memorial Dr and the Princes Hwy (except for a section in Fairy Meadow) will remain open throughout the event.

There will be closures on Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Masters Rd, Springhill Rd, Five Islands Rd and the Princes Hwy at Unanderra on Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 September only.

Towradgi Rd and Balgownie Rd will also remain open and provide a connection to the suburbs of Mt Ousley, Fairy Meadow, Towradgi and Balgownie.

Road closures for each day are displayed in the interactive maps below

  • Day 6 – Friday 23 September - closures are now in place
  • Day 7 – Saturday 24 September - closures between 6.45am and 3.30pm
  • Day 8 – Sunday 25 September - closures between 8.45am and 6pm

Special event clearway parking restrictions are now in effect on various roads along and surrounding the event courses through Wollongong and surrounding suburbs between Thursday 15 September and Sunday 25 September.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway, Corrimal Street, Squires Way, Pioneer Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Weddin Mountain Muster is a five-day horse trail riding event held in Grenfell from Monday 26 September to Friday 30 September.


On Tuesday 27 September, a 40 km/h speed reduction will be implemented on the Mid Western Highway at the Adelargo Road / Derribong Road intersection to ensure the horses can cross the highway safely. The speed reduction will be implemented only when horses are crossing.

Groups of a maximum of 40 horses will be permitted to cross the road at once, with spotters used to monitor all roads for traffic.

The Come Home to Gilgandra Festival is a 3-4 day event to bring the small country town of Gilgandra back to life after years of droughts, bushfires, the mice plague and the COVID-19 pandemic. 


On Saturday 1 October, a street parade will be held in the main street Castlereagh Highway & Oxley Highway will be closed between Wrigley Street and Wamboin Street from 9am until 12pm.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles: Wamboin St and Wrigley St in both directions.

Heavy vehicles: Federation St and/or Hargraves Ln

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Coonabarabran Pony Club Parade will take place on Friday 30 September 2022. The Newell Hwy (John St) will be closed between Edward St and Delgarno St between 3:00pm and 3:30pm.

Motorists will be detoured via Edwards St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardener St. The detour is suitable for all vehicles.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian and horse activity in the area and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

The Repco Bathurst 1000 kicks off on Wednesday 5 October with the Supercars Transporter and Drivers Parade.

Thousands of fans are expected to line Durham St and William St to cheer on their favourite teams and drivers.


From 11:15am unitl 12:30pm, Bentinck St will be closed between Great Western Hwy and Howick St. Traffic will be detoured via Havannah St and Howick St. Great Western Hwy between Durham St and William St will be reduced to one lane eastbound. Turning lanes from Great Western Hwy into William St, Bentinck St and Durham St will be closed. 


Traffic control will be in place for the safety of workers and motorists.  

 

Motorists are advised to drive to the conditions, and follow the directions of signs and traffic control.
properties.diversions: Bentinck St will be closed between Great Western Hwy and Howick St. Traffic will be detoured via Havannah St and Howick St.

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of motorsport fans are expected to attend the 2022 Repco Bathurst 1000 at Mount Panorama from Wednesday 5 October to Sunday 9 October.

 

Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

 

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

 

On Monday 10 October as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heaviest along the Great Western Highway towards Sydney with significant eastbound delays expected across the Blue Mountains. Traffic will also be heavy on the Mid Western Highway approaching Cowra and the Mitchell Highway towards Orange.

 

Changed traffic conditions including reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria and the Mid Western Highway at Cowra to manage traffic queues and ensure fans get home as safely as possible.

 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and particular on Monday morning.

Delays are expected on Mid Western Hwy in Cowra as thousands of motorsport fans make their way home from the Repco Bathurst 1000.


On Monday 10 October as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heavy on the Mid Western Highway approaching Cowra with reduced speed zones and traffic control in place to manage traffic queues and ensure fans get home as safely as possible.

 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Grand Final at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open from 1pm with preliminary matches from 1:20pm. NRL Grand Final kick-off at 7:30pm and full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium for the match.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

webLinks.linkText: Managing Traffic Congestion on Victoria Pass

properties.otherAdvice:
On Monday 10 October, traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains as fans return home from the Repco Bathurst 1000. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Epsom Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:50am, last race at 5:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Traffic will also be heavier than usual around the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


RANDWICK

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side

properties.otherAdvice:
Listen Out Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival, and to the races at nearby Royal Randwick Racecourse.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 8pm until 11pm to allow festivalgoers to safely leave the area.

Motorists driving in the area should allow extra travel time.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 4am until midnight on key roads in Surry Hills, Centennial Park and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park:

FROM 8PM TO 11PM

  • ​​Driver Avenue between ​Lang Road​ and ​the southern turning circle​ (both directions)
  • ​​Lang Road between Anzac Parade and ​Errol Flynn Boulevard (both directions)
  • Lang Road between ​Moore Park Road​ and ​Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Lang Road (westbound)

FROM 9PM TO 11PM

  • Moore Park Road* between Oatley Road and Regent Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Regent Street and Gordon Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)

*Managed access to/from the Entertainment Quarter

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Sydney Kings at WIN Entertainment Centre, start 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the game. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

Knockout Outdoor Music Festival at GIANTS Stadium and Sydney Showground. Start at 2pm finish at 11pm.

With up to 50,000 music fans expected, motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with large volumes of rideshare and taxi movements.

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Preliminary Final between the Penrith Panthers and South Sydney Rabbitohs at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Kick-off at 7:50pm and full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium for the match.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed, see the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event) to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around Crown St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Crown St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Crown St will be closed between Cleveland St and Foveaux St in both directions from 9am until 10:30pm.
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, High Holborn St, Jesson Lane, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Lane will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Baptist St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Randle St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Lane. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St 3 between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St 2 between Bourke St and Crown St
  • Devonshire St 3 between Wilshire St and Crown St (Westbound)
  • High Holborn St 1 between Lansdowne St and Miles Ss
  • Jesson Ln from Jesson St
  • Jesson St from Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between High Holborn St and Crown St
  • Miles St 2 between Crown St and High Holborn St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St

Notes:

  • 1 Resident Access permitted
  • 2 Resident Access permitted - contraflow arrangements will be in effect under traffic control
  • 3 Light rail corridor at Devonshire St to remain open at all times

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St between Crown St and 20m east of Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Lansdowne St between Crown St and 20m east of Crown St
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St
